item.title: eCitizen | A portal that offers access to information and services provided by the Kenyan Gorvernment
item.description:
eCitizen | A portal that offers access to information and services provided by the Kenyan Gorvernment

Kenyan Citizens and Foreign Residents can now apply for Government to Citizen (G2C) services and pay via mobile money, debit Cards and eCitizen agents.

item.title: Sheria by Sarabi Band Feat. Juliani
item.description:
Sheria by Sarabi Band Feat. Juliani

Fuata Sheria is about the state of Kenya's politics and of the failure of Kenya's citizens to take responsibility for their contribution to the corrupt status quo. The song is a call on Kenyans to retrospect and judge, not just the political leaders, but to judge themselves as well, and to 'fuata sheria' , to respect the rule of law.

item.description:
KenyaNiKwetu Street Interviews 3

Uploaded by James Quest on 2012-12-28.

item.title: Rufftone and The GSU - Mungu Baba
item.description:
Rufftone and The GSU - Mungu Baba

Music video of Rufftone and the GSU performing their song Mungu Baba, accompanied by the National Youth Orchestra of Kenya and the Tuvuke Peace initiative. Audio by Lampstand Records Video by Lampstand Videoz

item.title: Visions of a Future without Vultures - Kenyanpoet - A Kenyan Artistic Space
item.description:
Visions of a Future without Vultures - Kenyanpoet - A Kenyan Artistic Space

By Boniface Mwangi Four years ago, I quit active journalism because l was frustrated hearing and recording politicians tell lies to Kenyans every day. My swansong in journalism was the coverage of post-election violence, itself an enduring symbol of our collective failure. I knew and wanted to do something.

item.title: Kenyan MPs' bonus: Protesters march to parliament - BBC News
item.description:
Kenyan MPs' bonus: Protesters march to parliament - BBC News

Angry demonstrators in Kenya have marched to parliament to protest about a huge bonus MPs have voted to award themselves. Lawmakers in Kenya are among the highest paid MPs in Africa, receiving a salary of about $10,000 (Â£6,200) a month.

item.title: Wajukuu Arts Library
item.description:
Wajukuu Arts Library

On 21st May 2016, Mau Mau Collective together with Vitabu Vyetu & Wajukuu Arts, revived the Wajukuu Community Library in Lunga Lunga, Nairobi.
